unnormalised: Subject: My Journey with Yoga - More Than Just Poses
normalised: Subject: My Journey with Yoga - More Than Just Poses

unnormalised: I remember when I first started yoga, I was completely clueless. I’d see these pictures online of people bending into impossible shapes and thought, "That's definitely not for me!" I was a stressed-out software engineer in Bangalore, fueled by chai and late nights. My back was constantly aching, and my mind was always racing.
normalised: I remember when I first started yoga, I was completely clueless. I’d see these pictures online of people bending into impossible shapes and thought, "That's definitely not for me!" I was a stressed-out software engineer in Bangalore, fueled by chai and late nights. My back was constantly aching, and my mind was always racing.

unnormalised: My friend, Priya, finally convinced me to try a beginners' class at the Iyengar Yoga Centre near Jayanagar. The teacher, a kind lady named Asha ji, emphasized alignment and precision. It was tough at first! Holding Trikonasana for even a minute felt like an eternity.
normalised: My friend, Priya, finally convinced me to try a beginners' class at the Iyengar Yoga Centre near Jayanagar. The teacher, a kind lady named Asha ji, emphasized alignment and precision. It was tough at first! Holding Trikonasana for even a minute felt like an eternity.

unnormalised: But slowly, something shifted. I started noticing I felt calmer, more centered. The back pain lessened, and I actually looked forward to the classes. I even started practicing at home – a simple Suryanamaskar routine in the morning before rushing off to work.
normalised: But slowly, something shifted. I started noticing I felt calmer, more centered. The back pain lessened, and I actually looked forward to the classes. I even started practicing at home – a simple Suryanamaskar routine in the morning before rushing off to work.

unnormalised: Yoga isn't just about flexibility; it's about connecting your mind, body, and spirit. It's about being present in the moment, something I desperately needed. Now, I understand why so many ancient texts and gurus, all the way back to Patanjali, emphasize its importance.
normalised: Yoga isn't just about flexibility; it's about connecting your mind, body, and spirit. It's about being present in the moment, something I desperately needed. Now, I understand why so many ancient texts and gurus, all the way back to Patanjali, emphasize its importance.

unnormalised: And you know what’s funny? Even something like the film '3 Idiots,' with its emphasis on following your passions instead of blindly chasing success, resonates with the yogic principle of living authentically. Maybe Chatur should have tried a bit of yoga!
normalised: And you know what’s funny? Even something like the film 'three Idiots,' with its emphasis on following your passions instead of blindly chasing success, resonates with the yogic principle of living authentically. Maybe Chatur should have tried a bit of yoga!

unnormalised: It's been almost 5 years now, and while I can't do headstands or anything too fancy, yoga has become an integral part of my life. It’s more than just exercise; it’s a tool for managing stress, improving focus, and finding a little bit of peace in this chaotic world. I highly recommend everyone to give it a try!
